column4: how can i install ubuntu on a computer that will not boot from cd? I have looked around the 'net , but nothing has worked so far :(
all i have is a USB cd and the bios wont boot from usb or cd.
update your BIOS
i have the latest bios
and it can boot up winxp install cd fine?
just a curious factor that maybe either the burn wasn't successful and/or the drive is very picky
, he made some sort of special boot disk or something
uh huh.. that you may have a fair bit of issues with
I assume so, if your friend did that, then yes, however it would be a bit of a pain to try and get it from floppy to read it via cdrom
I mean in such a way that floppy is to be used to boot the cdrom
yeah, your choice seems to be somewhat very limited there, I assume you don't have built-in cdrom?
not built in, it is a tablet
well I don't know, your choices seems very very bleak, the only way I can see out is to write to the manufacturer asking for better support I suppose?
i loathe the manufacturer for doing this
my friend had created a boot floppy that enabled the usb cdrom, is there no way i can use something like that with ubuntu?

unfortunately, that's what you get with pre-built equipments, unless if you are daring to go for various other hacks that maybe floating around and if not lucky may cause your tablet to no longer operate
you said before that it didn't work
i said that what I tried didnt work, my friend got it to work
well.. I wonder what sort of options you get when you load up the floppy from there
i am not a computer guru, all i know is , this computer only will boot from HDD or floppy.

I suppose you can try it again, if it does not work, try to talk to your friend about it. I presume in worst case scenario, where he only knows how to do it for windows, then you maybe stuck with having to poke around again
i know that he got the computer to boot from floppy able to see the usb cd rom, then he just started XP setup...but i dont know how to do the boot disk
there are guides for it on the internet, I think bootdisk.com is one
thanks i will look
